channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Brigitte Bardot's complicated legacy, from film icon to far-right activism
item.description: French film star Brigitte Bardot left acting at her peak, devoting herself to animal rights while drawing criticism for her politics.
item.content:encoded: French film star Brigitte Bardot left acting at her peak, devoting herself to animal rights while drawing criticism for her politics.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Do Trump's claims about Christian persecution in Nigeria match reality?
item.description: Aaron Zelin, a senior fellow at the Washington Institute for Near East Policy, analyzes the U.S. strike on ISIS targets in Nigeria and the message it sends.
item.content:encoded: Aaron Zelin, a senior fellow at the Washington Institute for Near East Policy, analyzes the U.S. strike on ISIS targets in Nigeria and the message it sends.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Changing depictions of women at work in film
item.description: NPR's Kathryn Fink and Jordan Marie Smith talk about why Broadcast News still resonates in conversations about women and ambition.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Kathryn Fink and Jordan Marie Smith talk about why Broadcast News still resonates in conversations about women and ambition.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: A year of standout podcasts from NPR member stations
item.description: As the year wraps up, we're revisiting standout podcasts from NPR member stations in 2025.
item.content:encoded: As the year wraps up, we're revisiting standout podcasts from NPR member stations in 2025.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: Celebrate New Year's Eve with drinks made famous on screen
item.description: NPR's Tamara Keith steps into Death & Company bar in Washington, D.C., where movie-inspired cocktails set the mood for New Year's Eve.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Tamara Keith steps into Death & Company bar in Washington, D.C., where movie-inspired cocktails set the mood for New Year's Eve.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: The growing role of sports in President Trump's political brand
item.description: President Trump is increasingly embedding himself in sports culture. Christine Brennan, a longtime sports columnist and author, weighs in on the depths of Trump's ties to sports and what that will look like in the coming year.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is increasingly embedding himself in sports culture. Christine Brennan, a longtime sports columnist and author, weighs in on the depths of Trump's ties to sports and what that will look like in the coming year.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: U.S. ramps up Ukraine diplomacy as Zelensky meets Trump
item.description: President Trump hosts Zelensky amid intensified U.S. diplomacy aimed at ending Russia's war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: President Trump hosts Zelensky amid intensified U.S. diplomacy aimed at ending Russia's war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Memory loss: As AI gobbles up chips, prices for devices may rise
item.description: Demand for memory chips currently exceeds supply and there's very little chance of that changing any time soon. More chips for AI means less available for other products such as computers and phones and that could drive up those prices too.
item.content:encoded:
Demand for memory chips currently exceeds supply and there's very little chance of that changing any time soon. More chips for AI means less available for other products such as computers and phones and that could drive up those prices too.

(Image credit: Charlie Litchfield/ASSOCIATED PRESS)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Gangs use sexual violence to control communities in Haiti
item.description: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.content:encoded: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Is being in Congress still a good gig?
item.description: Inside Congress, lawmakers describe an institution under strain from polarization and constant pressure.
item.content:encoded: Inside Congress, lawmakers describe an institution under strain from polarization and constant pressure.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt
